citation.article-title: Moritella japonica sp. nov., a novel barophilic bacterium isolated from a Japan Trench sediment.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Moritella japonica sp. nov.
Moritella japonica (ja.pon.i.ca. L. gen. n. japonica named after the Japan Trench, from where this strain was isolated)
Cells are rod shaped; cell widths ranges from 0.8 to 1.0 μm, and cell lengths range from 2 to 4 μm.
Cells are Gram-negative and motile by means of a single unsheathed polar flagellum.
Colonies on Marine Agar 2216 after incubation at 10°C at atmospheric pressure are entire, smooth, and cream-colored.
The bacterium is halophilic and psychrophilic.
Best growth occurs at an NaCl concentration of ca. 3%.
No growth occurs in the absence of NaCl.
The optimal temperature for growth is from 10 to 15°C.
No growth occurs at 0 to 20°C.
It is a facultatively anaerobic chemoorganotroph having respiratory and fermentative types of metabolism.
Catalase and cytochrome oxidase tests are positive.
Acid is produced from D-glucose, but no gas is.
The organism does not produce H2S.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Arginine dihydrolase and ornithine decarboxylase tests are negative.
The lysine decarboxylase test is positive.
Acid is formed oxidatively from D-fructose, glycerol, and D-glucose.
No acid is produced from arabinose, cellobiose, D-galactose, myo-inositol, D-lactose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol, sucrose, D-trehalose, or xylose.
The G+C content of the DNA is about 45 mol%.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-7.
The dominant cellular fatty acids are 14:0, 16:0, 16:1, and 22:6 (DHA).
The type strain is strain DSK1, which has been deposited in the Japan Collection os Microorganisms as strain JCM 10249.
